title: 108_s878
content: In Section 1, an additional district judgeship is to be appointed for the northern district of Alabama. A technical amendment is made to the table under section 133(a) of title 28, United States Code, regarding the number of judges in Alabama. In Section 2, district judgeships for the District of Arizona are addressed. SEC. 2. Additional permanent district judgeships for the district of Arizona with 2 new appointments. Technical amendment for Arizona judgeship count to be 14. The President appoints additional district judges for California. Existing judgeship in the eastern district becomes permanent. Technical amendment made to the table under section 133(a) of title 28. The item relating to California in Title 28, United States Code, is amended by replacing it with new information. The President appoints 1 additional district judge for Idaho, with a technical amendment to the table under section 133(a) of title 28, United States Code. The President appoints 1 additional judge for the northern district of Iowa, with a provision that the first vacancy occurring 10 years after the confirmation date of the temporary judge shall not be filled. Additionally, a temporary judgeship for the district of Nebraska is converted to a permanent judgeship. The existing judgeship for the district of Nebraska is authorized under section 133 of title 28, United States Code. The table under section 133(a) of title 28 is amended to reflect this change. Additionally, a new district judgeship is established for the Eastern District of New York. SEC. 7. DISTRICT JUDGESHIPS FOR THE EASTERN DISTRICT OF NEW YORK. The President will appoint 2 additional district judges for the eastern district of New York with Senate approval. A technical amendment is made to the table under section 133(a) of title 28, United States Code. SEC. 8. TEMPORARY JUDGESHIP FOR THE EASTERN DISTRICT OF NEW YORK. Effective date for this subsection is the date of enactment of the Act or July 16, 2003. SEC. 8. The President appoints 1 additional judge for the eastern district of New York. The first vacancy after 10 years will not be filled. SEC. 9. 1 additional district judge for the district of South Carolina is appointed by the President. Technical amendment for South Carolina in title 28, United States Code. SEC. 10. An additional permanent district judgeship is established for the District of Utah, with the President appointing 1 additional district judge. Technical amendments are made for Utah in the United States Code. SEC. 11. Bankruptcy judgeships are addressed. The "Bankruptcy Judgeship Act of 2003" authorizes additional bankruptcy judgeships in various districts, including New York, Delaware, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Maryland, and North Carolina. The "Bankruptcy Judgeship Act of 2003" authorizes additional bankruptcy judgeships in various districts, including South Carolina, Virginia, Michigan, Tennessee, Arkansas, Nevada, Utah, and Florida. The "Bankruptcy Judgeship Act of 2003" authorizes additional bankruptcy judgeships in various districts, including Georgia, Puerto Rico, New York, and Pennsylvania. The "Bankruptcy Judgeship Act of 2003" authorizes additional bankruptcy judgeships in Maryland, northern and southern districts of Mississippi, and southern district of Georgia. Vacancies in these districts must occur 5 years after the appointment date of the bankruptcy judge. The "Bankruptcy Judgeship Act of 2003" authorizes additional bankruptcy judgeships in specific districts. Vacancies in these districts must occur due to specific reasons and may not be filled. Temporary bankruptcy judgeships in certain districts can be extended. The Bankruptcy Judgeship Act of 1992 extends temporary bankruptcy judgeships until the first vacancy in the office of a bankruptcy judge occurs 5 years after the enactment of the Act. Other provisions of the Act remain applicable to these temporary judgeships. Additionally, a bankruptcy judgeship shared by the Middle District of Georgia and the Southern District of Georgia may be transferred. The temporary bankruptcy judgeships in the District of Delaware and Puerto Rico authorized by the Bankruptcy Judgeship Act of 1992 will be converted to permanent judgeships. Additionally, a judgeship shared by the Middle District of Georgia and the Southern District of Georgia will be converted to a bankruptcy judgeship for the Middle District of Georgia. Technical amendments to title 28, United States Code, are also included. The item numbers for various districts in the United States Code are being amended to reflect changes in judgeships. This includes adjustments for districts in Arkansas, Delaware, Florida, and Georgia. The item numbers for various districts in the United States Code are being amended to reflect changes in judgeships. This includes adjustments for districts in Georgia, Maryland, Michigan, Nevada, New Jersey, New York, and North Carolina. The item numbers for various districts in the United States Code are being amended to reflect changes in judgeships. This includes adjustments for districts in Pennsylvania, Puerto Rico, South Carolina, Tennessee, Utah, and Virginia. The Senate passed the item numbers amendment on May 22, 2003.
